data.sampled: The answer depends on the specific service in question, as well as local laws and regulations regarding youth financial services. Some providers may not allow minors to open accounts without parent or guardian consent, while others may offer specialized accounts for younger users with limited functionality. If you're unsure about whether your children can access a particular financial product or service, we recommend reaching out directly to the provider or checking their website for more information. In general, young people under the legal age limit for financial contracts may require parental permission before accessing banking products or services.

I got a message that I need to verify my identity; what do I do?

data.sampled: If your card is stuck in an ATM, you should immediately report this issue to your bank or financial institution as soon as possible. They may ask you for additional information such as the location of the ATM, the time that the incident occurred, and whether any money was dispensed. Depending on the specific circumstances surrounding the incident, they may also recommend steps you can take next, such as visiting the nearest branch location or filing a police report if necessary. Your bank or financial institution's customer service team can provide guidance on how best to proceed in this situation. It is important not to attempt to physically retrieve the card yourself since doing so could result in further damage to both the card and the ATM machine.

I'm trying to transfer money to another country. It's just pending and not sending. My account details are correct. Please help me.

data.sampled:
The best way to use this app is by having your phone on hand, but that being said there may be situations in which you might not have access to your device, In those cases here are some suggestions:
1. If you have an iPad or tablet you can download the Monzo App from the Apple store to your iPad and register for an account using your phone number as your login method. Once registered you should be able to see all your accounts details including balances etc. As soon as you receive a new phone you can link your newly ordered sim and log back into your Monzo Account through their website using your registered email address. This will allow you to start transacting again.
2. Alternatively if you are close friends or family with someone who has already opened a Monzo account, they can add you as a second user to their account and once added, you can then open up the app and complete registration yourself.
3. Finally, if none of these options work, when calling customer support make sure to explain your situation and ask them what would be possible based upon your specific circumstances. They might be able to help you find another solution. Keep in mind however that certain features such as blocking your card won’t be available without having the app installed on your phone.
